definition: can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
leftist opportunism (blamed for failures of Chinese communists from 1927)/left adventurism/cf Mao's purges following 1935 Zunyi conference 遵義會議|遵义会议[Zun1 yi4 hui4 yi4]
pinyin: zuo3 qing1 ji1 hui4 zhu3 yi4
ji1 hui4 dai4 lai2 cheng2 gong1

definition: to watch for an opportunity/to see one's chance to

sentences.english: Blaine stopped to chat with a friend and Guiteau saw his chance.
sentences.chinese: 布莱恩停下来跟一位朋友聊天，吉特奥看到了机会。

sentences.english: It provides the opportunity to test unrelated applications running together.
sentences.chinese: 它提供了测试一起运行的无关应用程序的机会。

sentences.english: Pennies from heaven, the opportunity came up.
sentences.chinese: 喜从天降，机会突然来了。

sentences.english: For him to take that opportunity - he deserves a lot of respect for that.
sentences.chinese: 他则把握了那些机会，他配得上这些尊重。

sentences.english: She always thinks that she was born unlucky, and could not encounter main chances.
sentences.chinese: 她总觉得自己命薄，赶不上好机会。

sentences.english: The window of opportunity is shrinking, and differentiation is harder to claim.
sentences.chinese: 机会之窗正在变小，差异化更难断言。

sentences.english: I doubt an opportunity like this, for unschooling, will come again soon.
sentences.chinese: 对不上学来说，这样的机会不会太多。

sentences.english: Interning in college increases your chances of getting a job.
sentences.chinese: 在校期间实习将增加你找到工作的机会。

sentences.english: It is in times of adversities that your true character and qualities are shown.
sentences.chinese: 四面楚歌之时，正是你显露不凡气概与特质的机会。

sentences.english: Iwill look for every chance to speak English.
sentences.chinese: 我会寻求每一个机会来说英语。

sentences.english: When in Rome, do as the Romans do and take the chance to practice your English skills.
sentences.chinese: 入乡随俗，同时利用这个机会来练练你的英语吧。

sentences.english: I'm still a bit of a behind-the-striker player when possible.
sentences.chinese: 如果有机会，我仍然会更接近前锋身后的位置。

sentences.english: That makes it tough for Sisson to cheat, which she says is a "good thing."
sentences.chinese: 这使得西森难有机会作弊，但她认为这是件好事情。

sentences.english: This is a unique opportunity to get a progressive politician to be the president of the council.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个令进步政治家成为理事会主席得大好机会。

sentences.english: First Zheng Jiejiu has used up two challenge eagle-eyed opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 第一盘郑洁就用掉了两次挑战鹰眼的机会。

sentences.english: So I try hard to find opportunities for people like you.
sentences.chinese: 所以我努力为像你这样的人旬找机会。

definition: lapse/mistake/to make a mistake/fault/service fault (in volleyball, tennis etc)
to fight for/to strive for/to win over
to grasp (also fig.)/to seize/to hold/assurance/certainty/sure (of the outcome)
